intro: Hieracium enallophyllum, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, with a rough, hairy texture, and the flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium enallophyllum is often found in mountainous areas and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
